name: Beholder

specials.name: All-Around Vision
specials.description: This monster can see in all directions simultaneously, and therefore canâ€™t be flanked.

specials.name: Antimagic Cone
specials.description: The beholder's central eye creates an area of antimagic, as in the antimagic field spell, in a 120-foot-cone. As an action, the beholder can activate or deactivate this field or change the direction it's pointing. The area works against the beholder's own eye rays.

specials.name: Eye Beam
specials.description:
The beholder fires off a random eye beam from the list below at a target of its choice. It selects the target before determining the beam. By spending an additional action, the beholder can choose which eye beam it uses. It cannot use the same eye beam twice in a turn. The DC for all eye beams is 30.
1. Charm Ray. The target is affected by a 7th-level charm spell.
2. Paralyzing Ray. The target is affected by a 7th-level paralyze spell.
3. Fear Ray. The target is affected by a 7th-level fear spell.
4. Slow Ray. The target is affected by a 7th-level slow spell.
5. Enervation Ray. The target is affected by a 7th-level enervation spell.
6. Telekinetic Ray. The target is affected by a 7th-level telekinetic haul spell, even if it is a creature.
7. Sleep Ray. The target is affected by a 7th-level sleep spell.
8. Petrification Ray. The target is affected by a 7th-level flesh to stone spell.
9. Disintegration Ray. The target takes 6d10 force damage (basic Fortitude save). A creature reduced to 0 HP is reduced to fine powder; its gear remains.
10. Death Ray. The target is affected by a 7th-level finger of death spell.

specials.name: Hover
specials.description: The beholder can hover in place without spending an action, and they automatically succeed at all Acrobatics checks to Maneuver in Flight.

savenote: +1 status to all saves vs. magic
